meanings.definition: To grow or shoot up again from a cut or broken stem or root.
meanings.sent1: After the tree was pruned, it began to resprout new branches.
meanings.sent2: The plant will resprout fresh leaves in the spring.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cut the flower, but it decided to resprout and surprise me with new blooms.
meanings.sent4: Like a phoenix, the plant resprouted from its own ashes, stronger than before.
meanings.sent5: The grass resprouted vigorously after the lawnmower passed over it.

meanings.definition: To produce new growth after being cut back or pruned.
meanings.sent1: The rose bush will resprout beautiful flowers after trimming.
meanings.sent2: If you cut the hedge, it will resprout thicker and denser.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to resprout as a protest against the gardener's shears.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity resprouted after a period of artistic block.
meanings.sent5: The pumpkin vine resprouted with a vengeance, overtaking the garden.
